all sts be careful of gauge do not make bobble edge too tight break yarn i-cord start by knitting the i-cord along the part of the bonnet that frames the face measure a length of yarn three times the length of the facial perimeter of the bonnet do not break yarn use this tail you ve just measured out to pick up and knit sts starting at the bottom right corner with rs facing pick up and knit every 3 out of 4 sts along the vertical right edge then pick up and knit every stitch across the horizontal and then pick up and knit every 3 out of 4 sts along the vertical left edge once you ve picked up all the sts slide sts to the other side of the circular needle so that you can start knitting at the bottom right corner where you began picking up sts co 4 new sts using the backwards loop cast on knit i-cord as follows row 1 k3 k2tog tbl slide sts back to the other side of the needle 2 repeat row 1 until you ve worked the i-cord all the way around the facial perimeter bobble 3 sts knit the ties and the i-cord along the neck edge of the bonnet measure a length of yarn three times the length of the neck edge of the bonnet cut this piece of yarn from the ball and use it to pick up and knit in every st along the neck edge with the circular needles go back to the ball of yarn and using dpns co 6 sts using long tail cast on and knit i-cord for 10 inches or desired length of tie now you will attach the i-cord tie to the neck edge of the bonnet as you knit the i-cord row
